results.title: Metformin-loaded PLGA microspheres combined with an in situ-formed injectable SA/BG hydrogel alleviate rotator cuff muscle degeneration
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-loaded @CHEMICAL_Polylactic_Acid_Polyglycolic_Acid_Copolymer @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077182 @@@PLGA@@@ microspheres combined with an in situ-formed injectable @CHEMICAL_Alginates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000464 @@@SA@@@/BG hydrogel alleviate @<m>DISEASE_Rotator_Cuff_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000070636 @@@rotator cuff muscle degeneration@@@

citations.NLM: Wang Y, Song W, Li Y, Zhou Z, Li C, Yu W, He Y. Metformin-loaded PLGA microspheres combined with an in situ-formed injectable SA/BG hydrogel alleviate rotator cuff muscle degeneration Mater Today Bio. 2023 Dec;23():100874. PMID: 38075252

results.title: Metformin use is associated with a lower risk of rotator cuff disease in patients with Type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: Incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Rotator_Cuff_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000070636 @@@rotator cuff disease@@@ was 4.51 per 10,000 person-months in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ users and 5.11 in the controls.

citations.NLM: Chang R, Tu TY, Hung YM, Huang JY, Chou MC, Wei JC. Metformin use is associated with a lower risk of rotator cuff disease in patients with Type 2 diabetes mellitus. Diabetes Metab. 2022 Sep;48(5):101368. PMID: 35760373
citations.BibTeX: @article{35760373, title={Metformin use is associated with a lower risk of rotator cuff disease in patients with Type 2 diabetes mellitus.}, author={Chang R and Tu TY and Hung YM and Huang JY and Chou MC and Wei JC}, journal={Diabetes Metab}, volume={48}, number={5}, pages={101368}}

results.title: Metformin Mitigates Adipogenesis of Fibro-adipogenic Progenitors After Rotator Cuff Tears Via Activating mTOR/ULK1 Mediated Autophagy.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Mitigates Adipogenesis of Fibro-adipogenic Progenitors After @<m>DISEASE_Rotator_Cuff_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000070636 @@@Rotator Cuff Tears@@@ Via Activating @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mTOR@@@/@GENE_ULK1 @GENE_8408 @@@ULK1@@@ Mediated Autophagy.

results.title: Metformin inhibits muscle atrophy through the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway in a rat model of acute rotator cuff tears.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Six weeks after @<m>DISEASE_Rotator_Cuff_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000070636 @@@RC tendon rupture@@@, the SS weight in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group was significantly higher than in the control group.

citations.NLM: Yoon JP, Park SJ, Kim DH, Choi YS, Lee HJ, Chung SW. Metformin inhibits muscle atrophy through the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway in a rat model of acute rotator cuff tears. J Shoulder Elbow Surg. 2024 Dec 26;():. PMID: 39732387
